means: 告诉( inform的过去式和过去分词)

sentence.Network_en: There needs to be a properly informed public debate.
sentence.Network_cn: 有必要让公众在充分知情的状况下展开辩论。

sentence.Network_en: Sonia, we are reliably informed, loves her family very much.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们从可靠的消息来源获知索尼娅非常爱自己的家人。

sentence.Network_en: "State-owned industries will always perform poorly," John Moore informed readers.
sentence.Network_cn: “国有企业经营不善将是常态，”约翰·穆尔告诉读者。

entry.tran: 有知识的;了解情况的;见多识广的
entry.def: Someone who is informed knows about a subject or what is happening in the world.

example.ex: Informed people know the company is shaky.
example.tran: 了解情况的人知道该公司状况不佳。

example.ex: ...the importance of keeping the public properly informed.
example.tran: 使公众适当知情的重要性

entry.def: When journalists talk about informed sources, they mean people who are likely to give correct information because of their private or special knowledge.

example.ex: According to informed sources, those taken into custody include at least one major-general.
example.tran: 据可靠消息,那些被拘捕者当中至少有一位少将。

entry.tran: (猜测或决策)明智的,有见识的
entry.def: An informed guess or decision is one that likely to be good, because it is based on definite knowledge or information.

example.ex: An informed guess at his personal wealth was $1.25 billion...
example.tran: 据合理猜测，他的个人财产有 12.5 亿美元。

example.ex: We are able to make more informed choices about how we use drugs.
example.tran: 我们能够更加明智地选择如何使用药物。

sentences.en: She reads many magazines to stay informed.
sentences.cn: 为了掌握信息她阅读许多杂志。
